title: Relic shield is so hard to use mid and late game;
body:
I've seen some people upgrade to Face of the Mountain as a first item for the extra Charges and the Cooldown Reduction and stats aren't too shabby, but I only usually ever go into Targon's Brace then finish an Armor or MR or w/e item because I feel like it's impossible to trigger at later stages of the game - to the point where I feel like even investing in it beyond upping the passive gold with Targon's - and taking it into a fully fledged item that gives a Gold acquiring passive - is a waste.

Anyone else feel like this when they are playing Tanky supports?

Like I literally go near a creep wave and before I can land one auto it's already dead - and while early game people will let you trigger it - for the purpose of pushing and/or lane control or w/e it becomes counter-productive to wait for the support to trigger the passive. I can't trigger it in between roaming because you need an ally nearby so come mid-game it's basically a useless item: This is why I normally don't get face of the mountain; because I feel like a Major part of that item is having the 4 procs on minion waves and I feel like by the time you've got it - in most games; laning phase is over and you could have had a banner, Locket, Righteous Glory or a tank item - with far better statistics instead and all that gold for just 1 extra proc with no change to the gold acquired like by upgrading relic into Targon's - seems wasted when considering the stats other items provide.

replies.body: It can be a life saving item.

Most supports can 1-hit caster creeps mid-late game with targons execute. Just focus the ranged creeps and you should get 1 or 2 per wave. Of course when you are pushing as 5, who gives a crap if you can proc targons or not.

since supports would and/or should be doing nothing but being supportive of their team, it is more optimal to be building towards protecting your adc (who are optimally built for full dps) and using your unique supportive abilities as best as possible for the benefit of helping your team defeat your opponents. all end product support items give you something that will help your adc and your team in being more supportive with a ms buff, an aoe slow and a protective shield (as well as 10% cdr). also if you're playing as a true support, meaning not master yu support with 30/0/0 masteries, you should be farming as little as possible in the hopes that your other team members can pick up the gold to buy more expensive more effective combat stats. since you'd optimally be farming as little as possible the only good way to make decent gold is to proc relic/targons/face as much as possible. earlier investment into higher proc caps means you can proc it more times giving more gold to you and your team member, meaning ultimately, you're getting more gold for your team
